question.questionText: Does the patient currently require tube feeding

dataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator to ask if a patient currently needs to use a feeding tube to meet their nutritional needs.

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
The affirmative response to a question.
Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

question.questionText: Is patient dependent on tube feeding for greater than 50% of nutritional support

dataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator to ask if 50 percent or more of a patient"s nutritional needs are being provided through use of feeding tube.

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
The affirmative response to a question.
Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

referenceDocument.name: Is patient dependent on tube
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient dependent on tube feeding for >50% of nutritional support

referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient dependent on tube feeding for greater than 50% of nutritional support

validValue.description: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

dataElement.longName: Nutritional Support Feeding Tube Administered Type
dataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of feeding tube inserted in a patient for administration of nutritional support.

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tube that is inserted through the nose, down the throat and esophagus, and into the stomach. It can be used to give drugs, liquids, and liquid food, or used to remove substances from the stomach. Giving food through a gastric feeding tube is a type of enteral nutrition.
The placement of a feeding tube through the abdominal wall into the stomach using an endoscope.
The placement of a feeding tube through the abdominal wall into the stomach with the assistance of fluoroscopic guidance.
Administration of a drug through a surgical opening between the jejunum and the surface of the abdominal wall.

A small bore flexible feeding tube with a weighted metal tip that is ideally placed in the second or third part of the duodenum. It is used to provide nutritional support to patients who are unable to tolerate oral feeding or who require mechanical ventilation.

validValue.description: A tube that is inserted through the nose, down the throat and esophagus, and into the stomach. It can be used to give drugs, liquids, and liquid food, or used to remove substances from the stomach. Giving food through a gastric feeding tube is a type of enteral nutrition.
The placement of a feeding tube through the abdominal wall into the stomach using an endoscope.
The placement of a feeding tube through the abdominal wall into the stomach with the assistance of fluoroscopic guidance.

classification.name: PICUcoreClinicalData
classification.preferredDefinition: Descriptive information about pediatric intensive care unit (PICU) discharges from NICHD Collaborative Pediatric Critical Care Research Network (CPCCRN) Clinical Centers, based primarily on hospital billing databases. The Core Clinical Data Project (CCDP) provides pilot and descriptive data for hypothesis generation, study design, preliminary power analyses, and recruitment projections for CPCCRN studies under development.

classification.name: C3PR
classification.preferredDefinition: Version 2.8 The Cancer Central Clinical Participent Registry (C3PR) is a web-based application used to manage participants in cancer clinical trials. Research staff will use C3PR as a participant-centric entry point to clinical trial management systems. C3PR provides a central registry for study participants, and it enables the end-user to access participant-centric information that is stored in multiple clinical trial systems. Participants that can be tracked include patients or potential patients, their guardians, family members, and referring physicians. The system also allows tracking other types of participants such as principal investigators, caregivers, referring physicians, and the users of the system.

classification.name: C3PR
classification.preferredDefinition: Version 2.8 The Cancer Central Clinical Participent Registry (C3PR) is a web-based application used to manage participants in cancer clinical trials. Research staff will use C3PR as a participant-centric entry point to clinical trial management systems. C3PR provides a central registry for study participants, and it enables the end-user to access participant-centric information that is stored in multiple clinical trial systems. Participants that can be tracked include patients or potential patients, their guardians, family members, and referring physicians. The system also allows tracking other types of participants such as principal investigators, caregivers, referring physicians, and the users of the system.

classification.name: CRF Disease
classification.preferredDefinition: this scheme is used to classify by disease case report forms and their associated data elements. Assignments to this scheme should not be made manually but occur through use of the CRF Loader and the CRT.

classification.name: CRF Trial Type Usage
classification.preferredDefinition: this scheme is used to classify by trial type usage case report forms and their associated data elements. Assignments to this scheme should not be made manually but occur through use of the CRF Loader and the CRT.
